controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.Controller

  • public final class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to generate and execute various search algorithms on a 2-dimensional rectangular search area.
    Author:
    Ken Norman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Controller.SearchArea
      An area to be searched by some search algorithm.

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public boolean setUp(int width,
            int height,
            Algorithm a)
        Set up the components needed to perform a search:
        • A search area with given width and height in which to search
        • The algorithm that will conduct the search

        This method checks for positive values of height and width, and checks that a is not null.

        Parameters:
        width - The width of the search area.
        height - The height of the search area.
        a - An algorithm used to search.
        Returns:
        true if the setup succeeded;
        false if (width < 1 || height < 1 || a == null).

      • setStart

        public boolean setStart(int x,
               int y)
        Set the location of the start node. This method (as well as setFinish(int, int) is required prior to executing the search algorithm.

        NOTE: If there is an obstacle already set at the (x, y) coordinate, the obstacle will be replaced. However, if the finish location is already set at the (x, y) coordinate, the start location will not be set.

        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the start node.
        y - The y coordinate of the start node.
        Returns:
        true if set
        false otherwise

      • setFinish

        public boolean setFinish(int x,
                int y)
        Set the location of the finish node. This method (as well as setStart(int, int) is required prior to executing the search algorithm.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the start node.
        y - The y coordinate of the start node.
        Returns:
        true if set
        false otherwise

      • addObstacle

        public boolean addObstacle(int x0,
                  int y0,
                  int x1,
                  int y1)
        Adds an obstacle to the search area. An obstacle is a line from a starting point (x0, y0) to an ending point (x1, y1), inclusive.
        Parameters:
        x0 - The x coordinate of the starting point.
        y0 - The y coordinate of the starting point.
        x1 - The x coordinate of the ending point.
        y1 - The y coordinate of the ending point.
        Returns:
        true if the obstacle was added
        false in either or both of these cases:
        • any part of the line is outside the search area
        • the line overlaps the start node or the finish node (or both)
        See Also:
        Controller.SearchArea.addObstacle(int, int, int, int)

      • addObstacle

        public boolean addObstacle(int x,
                  int y)
        Designate a single node as an obstacle.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the node.
        y - The y coordinate of the node.
        Returns:
        true if the obstacle was successfully added
        false otherwise

      • executeSearch

        public boolean executeSearch()
        Execute the search algorithm.
        Returns:
        true if the algorithm successfully executed
        false otherwise

      • print

        public void print()
        Prints the search area as a grid, and displays the start node, finish node, all obstacle nodes, and the solution path.
        See Also:
        NodeStatus.getSymbol()

      • getInstance

        public static Controller getInstance()
        Gets the single instance of Controller.
        Returns:
        The Controller.

      • getAlgorithm

        public Algorithm getAlgorithm()
        Gets the algorithm.
        Returns:
        The algorithm, or null if never initialized.

      • getSearchArea

        public Controller.SearchArea getSearchArea()
        Gets the search area. The setUp(int, int, Algorithm) method must be invoked first since it is the only method which can access SearchArea's private constructor. Otherwise, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        The search area, or null if no search area object exists.
